newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Western Metals says zinc mine on target.
newsitem.headline: Western Metals says zinc mine on target.

text.p: Western Metals Ltd said on Wednesday that its plan to acquire 100 percent ownership of the Blendevale zinc and lead project would ensure the project would be commissioned on schedule in mid-1998.

Acacia Resources Ltd said earlier on Wednesday that it would sell its 40.1 percent stake in the project and associated interests in the Lennard Shelf area of Western Australia to Western Metals for A$27 million and eight million Western Metals options exercisable at A$1.15 each.

"Our target remains for Western Metals' Lennard Shelf complex to be producing approximately 160,000 tonnes of zinc and 60,000 tonnes of lead in concentrates a year by 1998/99 (July/June)," Western Metals managing director Rod Webster said.
The production rate is a 60 percent increase over Western Metals' current output and would make Western Metals the world's seventh biggest producer of zinc, he said in a statement.
Western Metals currently mines zinc and lead at the Cadjebut and Goongewa deposits in the Kimberley region of Western Australia.
Acacia said it was selling its stake to concentrate on gold mining and exploration.
